title: Rent (musical)
summary: Rent  (stylized as RENT) is a rock musical with music, lyrics, and book by Jonathan Larson,[1] loosely based on Giacomo Puccini's 1896 opera La Boh√®me. It tells the story of a group of impoverished young artists struggling to survive and create a life in Lower Manhattan's East Village in the thriving days of bohemian Alphabet City, under the shadow of HIV/AIDS.
